summary: This document is a compilation of news clips from January 30, 2020, covering multiple cases handled by the Southern District of New York. It includes updates on the Michael Avenatti extortion trial, Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation in the Epstein investigation, the prosecution of Epstein's jail guards, Lev Parnas' case, and other unrelated legal matters. The clips highlight ongoing legal proceedings and public controversies related to the Epstein case and other high-profile figures.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.context: Allegedly attempted to extort Nike for $20 million, with testimony stating he didn't care about harming teenage basketball players.

persons.name: Scott Wilson
persons.context: Testified about Avenatti's alleged extortion attempts and recorded phone calls with him.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: British royal, associate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Facing scrutiny for lack of cooperation with the FBI regarding Epstein, with U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stating he provided 'zero cooperation'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender
persons.context: Referenced as the central figure in the sex trafficking case; died by suicide in jail while awaiting trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as Epstein's ex-girlfriend and alleged conspirator; a former police officer described her visits to Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Stated publicly that Prince Andrew had provided zero cooperation to the FBI in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.role: Attorney representing some of Epstein's alleged victims
persons.context: Stated she would try to subpoena Prince Andrew if he entered the United States.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.role: Defense attorney for a jail guard
persons.context: Representing a guard accused of faking inmate checks the night Epstein died; plans to argue selective prosecution.

persons.name: Tova M
persons.context: One of two guards charged with faking inmate checks at the jail where Epstein died.

persons.name: Analisa Torres
persons.context: Presided over the hearing for the jail guards, setting a new trial date and engaging in a tense exchange with defense counsel.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Represented the second jail guard; had a heated exchange with Judge Torres over the trial date.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Represented the government in the jail guard case, mentioned plea talks are ongoing.

persons.name: Lev Parnas
persons.role: Defendant, former associate of Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Charged with illegal campaign contributions; new audio appears to show him at a dinner with President Trump.

persons.name: Igor Fruman
persons.context: Co-defendant with Parnas, charged with conspiring to make illegal campaign contributions.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Appears in audio with Lev Parnas at a fundraising dinner; downplayed association with Parnas.

persons.name: Pete Sessions
persons.context: Believed to be 'Congressman One' in Parnas indictment; attended dinner with Trump and Parnas.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Allegedly used Parnas as a fixer in Ukraine to dig up information on Hunter Biden.

persons.name: Joseph A. Bondy
persons.context: Released audio appearing to show Parnas at a dinner with President Trump.

persons.name: John Bolton
persons.context: Mentioned in opinion piece regarding the Senate impeachment trial, suggesting he has damaging evidence against President Trump.

connections.description: Described as having a friendship; Andrew is under scrutiny for his association with Epstein.
A former police officer stated Maxwell was a frequent visitor to Prince Andrew, with her name not to be entered in the visitor book.
Business partners charged together with conspiring to make illegal campaign contributions.
Audio and photos appear to show Parnas at a fundraising dinner with President Trump, though Trump downplays knowing him.
Parnas hired Giuliani in 2018; Giuliani allegedly later used Parnas as a fixer in Ukraine.
Figgins is the defense attorney for the other jail guard defendant in the same case; they are co-defendants.

events.title: Avenatti extortion trial testimony
events.description: Second day of testimony in Michael Avenatti's extortion trial, with Nike attorney Scott Wilson recounting meetings and recorded calls where Avenatti allegedly demanded $20 million from Nike.

events.title: Berman states Prince Andrew non-cooperation
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated in a press conference that Prince Andrew has provided 'zero cooperation' to the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Jail guard trial date postponed
events.description: Judge Analisa Torres postponed the trial date for two guards accused of faking inmate checks at the jail where Epstein died, setting a new date for June 22, 2020.

events.title: Epstein's death in jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead by suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center; guards are accused of failing to check on him.

events.title: Parnas at Trump dinner
events.description: New audio released appears to show Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman attending a fundraising dinner with President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly stated Prince Andrew had provided 'zero cooperation' to the FBI in the Epstein investigation, contradicting Andrew's public offers to help.
A former police officer who worked as Prince Andrew's protection agent claimed Ghislaine Maxwell's visits to Andrew were kept off the official visitor log.
The trial for two jail guards accused of faking checks on inmates the night Epstein died was postponed to June 22, 2020, with one defense attorney planning a selective prosecution argument.
New audio evidence was released appearing to show Lev Parnas, a defendant in a campaign finance case, at a fundraising dinner with President Donald Trump in April 2018.
The news clips document ongoing legal proceedings in multiple high-profile cases being handled by the Southern District of New York in early 2020.
